00017 package WeBWorK::Constants;

00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::Constants - provide constant values for other WeBWorK modules.

00025 use strict;
00026 use warnings;

00028 ################################################################################
00029 # WeBWorK::Debug
00030 ################################################################################
00031 
00032 # If true, WeBWorK::Debug will print debugging output.
00033 #
00034 $WeBWorK::Debug::Enabled = 0;
00035 
00036 # If non-empty, debugging output will be sent to the file named rather than STDERR.
00037 #
00038 $WeBWorK::Debug::Logfile = "";
00039 
00040 # If defined, prevent subroutines matching the following regular expression from
00041 # logging.
00042 #
00043 # For example, this pattern prevents the dispatch() function from logging:
00044 #     $WeBWorK::Debug::DenySubroutineOutput = qr/^WeBWorK::dispatch$/;
00045 #
00046 $WeBWorK::Debug::DenySubroutineOutput = undef;
00047 
00048 # If defined, allow only subroutines matching the following regular expression
00049 # to log.
00050 #
00051 # For example, this pattern allow only some function being worked on to log:
00052 #     $WeBWorK::Debug::AllowSubroutineOutput = qr/^WeBWorK::SomePkg::myFunc$/;
00053 #
00054 $WeBWorK::Debug::AllowSubroutineOutput = undef;
00055 
00056 ################################################################################
00057 # WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Hardcopy
00058 ################################################################################
00059 
00060 # If true, don't delete temporary files
00061 #
00062 $WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Hardcopy::PreserveTempFiles = 0;
00063 
00064 ################################################################################
00065 # WeBWorK::PG::Local
00066 ################################################################################
00067 # The maximum amount of time (in seconds) to work on a single problem.
00068 # At the end of this time a timeout message is sent to the browser.
00069 
00070 $WeBWorK::PG::Local::TIMEOUT = 60;
00071 
00072 ################################################################################
00073 # WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator
00074 ################################################################################
00075 
00076 # Arguments to pass to dvipng. This is dependant on the version of dvipng.
00077 #
00078 # For dvipng versions 0.x
00079 #     $WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator::DvipngArgs = "-x4000.5 -bgTransparent -Q6 -mode toshiba -D180";
00080 # For dvipng versions 1.0 to 1.5
00081 #     $WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator::DvipngArgs = "-bgTransparent -D120 -q -depth";
00082 #
00083 # For dvipng versions 1.6 (and probably above)
00084 #     $WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator::DvipngArgs = "-bgtransparent -D120 -q -depth";
00085 # Note: In 1.6 and later, bgTransparent gives alpha-channel transparency while
00086 # bgtransparent gives single-bit transparency. If you use alpha-channel transparency,
00087 # the images will not be viewable with MSIE.  bgtransparent works for version 1.5,
00088 # but does not give transparent backgrounds. It does not work for version 1.2. It has not
00089 # been tested with other versions.
00090 #
00091 $WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator::DvipngArgs = "-bgTransparent -D120 -q -depth";
00092 
00093 # If true, don't delete temporary files
00094 #
00095 $WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator::PreserveTempFiles = 0;
00096 
00097 # TeX to prepend to equations to be processed.
00098 #
00099 $WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator::TexPreamble = <<'EOF';
00100 \documentclass[12pt]{article}
00101 \nonstopmode
00102 \usepackage{amsmath,amsfonts,amssymb}
00103 \def\gt{>}
00104 \def\lt{<}
00105 \usepackage[active,textmath,displaymath]{preview}
00106 \begin{document}
00107 EOF
00108 
00109 # TeX to append to equations to be processed.
00110 #
00111 $WeBWorK::PG::ImageGenerator::TexPostamble = <<'EOF';
00112 \end{document}
00113 EOF
00114 
00115 ################################################################################
00116 # WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Instructor::Config
00117 ################################################################################
00118 
00119 # Configuation data
00120 # It is organized by section.  The allowable types are
00121 #  'text' for a text string (no quote marks allowed),
00122 #  'number' for a number,
00123 #  'list' for a list of text strings,
00124 #  'permission' for a permission value,
00125 #  'boolean' for variables which really hold 0/1 values as flags.
00126 #  'checkboxlist' for variables which really hold a list of values which
00127 #      can be independently picked yes/no as checkboxes
00128

00207  formulas via an options box in the left panel.  Here, you can adjust what display modes are
00208  listed.<p>
00209  Some display modes require other software to be installed on the server.  Be sure to check
00210  that all display modes selected here work from your server.<p>
00211  The display modes are <ul>
00212 <li> plainText: shows the raw LaTeX strings for formulas.
00213 <li> formattedText: formulas are passed through the external program <code>tth</code>,
00214  which produces an HTML version of them.  Some browsers do not display all of the fonts
00215  properly.
00216 <li> images: produces images using the external programs LaTeX and dvipng.
00217 <li> jsMath: uses javascript to place symbols, which may come from fonts or images
00218  (the choice is configurable by the end user).
00219 <li> MathJax: a successor to jsMath, uses javascript to place render mathematics.
00220 <li> asciimath: renders formulas client side using ASCIIMathML
00221 <li> LaTeXMathML: renders formulas client side using LaTeXMathML
00222 </ul>
00223 <p>
00224 You must use at least one display mode.  If you select only one, then the options box will
00225  not give a choice of modes (since there will only be one active).',
